result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristopher J Lorenzo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  Cash bail to be refunded to poster.
Continue with AODA treatment.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

No contact with Thomas A. or Joseph H.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Defendant Kristopher J Lorenzo in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Konrad Paczuski, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Recommendations by the State.  Arguments by the Defense.  Statement by Defendant.

Court orders the following:
- Sentence withheld
- 18 months Probation. 
- Cash bail to be refunded to poster
- Court costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Continue with AODA treatment.  No contact with Thomas A. or Joseph H.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.  
CONDITION TIME: 4 months - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - STAYED for use by Agent.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of successful completion of probation, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.
